   20: -module(epp_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([rec_1/1, include_local/1, predef_mac/1,
   25: 	 upcase_mac_1/1, upcase_mac_2/1,
   26: 	 variable_1/1, otp_4870/1, otp_4871/1, otp_5362/1,
   27:          pmod/1, not_circular/1, skip_header/1, otp_6277/1, gh_4995/1, otp_7702/1,
   28:          otp_8130/1, overload_mac/1, otp_8388/1, otp_8470/1,
   29:          otp_8562/1, otp_8665/1, otp_8911/1, otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1,
   30:          otp_11728/1, encoding/1, extends/1,  function_macro/1,
   31: 	 test_error/1, test_warning/1, otp_14285/1,
   32: 	 test_if/1,source_name/1,otp_16978/1,otp_16824/1,scan_file/1,file_macro/1,
   33:    deterministic_include/1, nondeterministic_include/1, moduledoc_include/1]).
   34: 
   35: -export([epp_parse_erl_form/2]).
   36: 
   37: %%
   38: %% Define to run outside of test server
   39: %%
   40: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   41: 
   42: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   43: -compile(export_all).
   44: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   45: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   46: %% -define(t, test_server).
   47: -define(t, io).
   48: config(priv_dir, _) ->
   49:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_priv");
   50: config(data_dir, _) ->
   51:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_data").
   52: -else.
   53: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   54: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   55: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   56: 
   57: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: -endif.
   63: 
   64: suite() ->
   65:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   66:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   67: 
   68: all() ->
   69:     [rec_1, {group, upcase_mac}, include_local, predef_mac,
   70:      {group, variable}, otp_4870, otp_4871, otp_5362, pmod,
   71:      not_circular, skip_header, otp_6277, gh_4995, otp_7702, otp_8130,
   72:      overload_mac, otp_8388, otp_8470, otp_8562,
   73:      otp_8665, otp_8911, otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11728,
   74:      encoding, extends, function_macro, test_error, test_warning,
   75:      otp_14285, test_if, source_name, otp_16978, otp_16824, scan_file, file_macro,
   76:      deterministic_include, nondeterministic_include, moduledoc_include].
   77: 
   78: groups() ->
   79:     [{upcase_mac, [], [upcase_mac_1, upcase_mac_2]},
   80:      {variable, [], [variable_1]}].
   81: 
   82: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   83:     Config.
   84: 
   85: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   86:     ok.
   87: 
   88: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   92:     Config.
   93: 
   94: %% Recursive macros hang or crash epp (OTP-1398).
   95: rec_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac.erl"),
   97:     {ok, List} = epp_parse_file(File, [], []),
   98:     %% we should encounter errors
   99:     {value, _} = lists:keysearch(error, 1, List),
  100:     check_errors(List),
  101:     ok.
  102: 
  103: include_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  104:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  105:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "include_local.erl"),
  106:     FooHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","foo.hrl"]),
  107:     BarHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","bar.hrl"]),
  108:     %% include_local.erl includes include/foo.hrl which
  109:     %% includes bar.hrl (also in include/) without requiring
  110:     %% any additional include path, and overriding any file
  111:     %% of the same name that the path points to
  112:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [DataDir], []),
  113:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{true,true}}} =
  114: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  115:     [{File,1},{FooHrl,1},{BarHrl,1},{FooHrl,5},{File,5}] =
  116:         [ FileLine || {attribute,_,file,FileLine} <- List ],
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: file_macro(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  121:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "file_macro.erl"),
  122:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  123:                                        {source_name, "Other source"}]),
  124:     %% Both attribute a and b are defined as ?FILE, they should be the same
  125:     {attribute,_,a,FileA} = lists:keyfind(a, 3, List),
  126:     {attribute,_,b,FileB} = lists:keyfind(b, 3, List),
  127:     "Other source" = FileA = FileB,
  128:     ok.
  129: 
  130: moduledoc_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  131:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  132:     ModuleFileContent = <<"-module(moduledoc).
  133: 
  134:                            -moduledoc {file, \"README.md\"}.
  135: 
  136:                            -export([]).
  137:                           ">>,
  138:     DocFileContent = <<"# README
  139: 
  140:                         This file is a test
  141:                        ">>,
  142:     CreateFile = fun (Dir, File, Content) ->
  143:                      Dirname = filename:join([PrivDir, Dir]),
  144:                      ok = create_dir(Dirname),
  145:                      Filename = filename:join([Dirname, File]),
  146:                      ok = file:write_file(Filename, Content),
  147:                      Filename
  148:                  end,
  149: 
  150:     %% positive test: checks that all works as expected
  151:     ModuleName = CreateFile("module_attr", "moduledoc.erl", ModuleFileContent),
  152:     DocName = CreateFile("module_attr", "README.md", DocFileContent),
  153:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(ModuleName, []),
  154:     {attribute, _, moduledoc, ModuleDoc} = lists:keyfind(moduledoc, 3, List),
  155:     ?assertEqual({ok, unicode:characters_to_binary(ModuleDoc)}, file:read_file(DocName)),
  156: 
  157:     %% negative test: checks that we produce an expected error
  158:     ModuleErrContent = binary:replace(ModuleFileContent, <<"README">>, <<"NotExistingFile">>),
  159:     ModuleErrName = CreateFile("module_attr", "moduledoc_err.erl", ModuleErrContent),
  160:     {ok, ListErr} = epp:parse_file(ModuleErrName, []),
  161:     {error,{_,epp,{moduledoc,file, "NotExistingFile.md"}}} = lists:keyfind(error, 1, ListErr),
  162: 
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: create_dir(Dir) ->
  166:     case file:make_dir(Dir) of
  167:         ok -> ok;
  168:         {error, eexist} -> ok;
  169:         _ -> error
  170:     end.
  171: 
  172: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  173:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  174:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  175:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  176:                                        {deterministic, true},
  177:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  178: 
  179:     %% In deterministic mode, only basenames, rather than full paths, should
  180:     %% be written to the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  181:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  182:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"baz.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  183:                        (_) -> false
  184:                      end,
  185:                      List),
  186:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  187:             "including baz.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  188:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  189:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"file.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  190:                        (_) -> false
  191:                      end,
  192:                      List),
  193:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  194:             "including file.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  195:     ok.
  196: 
  197: nondeterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  198:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  199:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  200:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  201:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  202: 
  203:     %% Outside of deterministic mode, full paths, should be written to
  204:     %% the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  205:     %% to make debugging easier.
  206:     %% We don't try to assume what the full absolute path will be in the
  207:     %% unit test, since that can depend on the environment and how the
  208:     %% test is executed. Instead, we just look for whether there is
  209:     %% the parent directory along with the basename at least.
  210:     IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","baz.hrl"),
  211:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  212:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_Line}}) ->
  213:                          lists:suffix(IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  214:                        (_) -> false
  215:                      end,
  216:                      List),
  217:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  218:             "including baz.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  219:     IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","file.hrl"),
  220:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  221:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_line}}) ->
  222:                          lists:suffix(IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  223:                        (_) -> false
  224:                      end,
  225:                      List),
  226:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  227:             "including file.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: %%% Here is a little reimplementation of epp:parse_file, which times out
  231: %%% after 4 seconds if the epp server doesn't respond. If we use the
  232: %%% regular epp:parse_file, the test case will time out, and then epp
  233: %%% server will go on growing until we dump core.
  234: epp_parse_file(File, Inc, Predef) ->
  235:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  236: 				     epp:open(File, Inc, Predef)
  237: 			     end),
  238:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  239: 				     Opts = [{name, File},
  240: 					     {includes, Inc},
  241: 					     {macros, Predef}],
  242: 				     epp:open(Opts)
  243: 			     end),
  244:     {ok, List}.
  245: 
  246: do_epp_parse_file(Open) ->
  247:     {ok, Epp} = Open(),
  248:     List = collect_epp_forms(Epp),
  249:     epp:close(Epp),
  250:     List.
  251: 
  252: collect_epp_forms(Epp) ->
  253:     Result = epp_parse_erl_form(Epp),
  254:     case Result of
  255: 	{error, _Error} ->
  256: 	    [Result | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  257: 	{ok, Form} ->
  258: 	    [Form | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  259: 	{eof, _} ->
  260: 	    [Result]
  261:     end.
  262: 
  263: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp) ->
  264:     P = spawn(?MODULE, epp_parse_erl_form, [Epp, self()]),
  265:     receive
  266: 	{P, Result} ->
  267: 	    Result
  268:     after 4000 ->
  269: 	    exit(Epp, kill),
  270: 	    exit(P, kill),
  271: 	    timeout
  272:     end.
  273: 
  274: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp, Parent) ->
  275:     Parent ! {self(), epp:parse_erl_form(Epp)}.
  276: 
  277: check_errors([]) ->
  278:     ok;
  279: check_errors([{error, Info} | Rest]) ->
  280:     {Line, Mod, Desc} = Info,
  281:     case Line of
  282: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  283: 	{L,C} when is_integer(L), is_integer(C), C >= 1 -> ok
  284:     end,
  285:     Str = lists:flatten(Mod:format_error(Desc)),
  286:     [Str] = io_lib:format("~s", [Str]),
  287:     check_errors(Rest);
  288: check_errors([_ | Rest]) ->
  289:     check_errors(Rest).
  290: 
  291: 
  292: upcase_mac_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  294:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  295:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  296:     Tuple = {1, 1, 3, 3},
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: upcase_mac_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  301:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], [{p, 5}, {'P', 6}]),
  302:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  303:     Tuple = {5, 5, 6, 6},
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: predef_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac3.erl"),
  308:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  309:     [_,
  310:      {attribute, Anno, l, Line1},
  311:      {attribute, _, f, File},
  312:      {attribute, _, machine1, _},
  313:      {attribute, _, module, mac3},
  314:      {attribute, _, m, mac3},
  315:      {attribute, _, ms, "mac3"},
  316:      {attribute, _, machine2, _}
  317:      | _] = List,
  318:     Line1 = erl_anno:line(Anno),
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: variable_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  323:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "variable_1.erl"),
  324:     true = os:putenv("VAR", DataDir),
  325:     %% variable_1.erl includes variable_1_include.hrl and
  326:     %% variable_1_include_dir.hrl.
  327:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  328:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{value1,value2}}} =
  329: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: %% undef without module declaration.
  333: otp_4870(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     Ts = [{otp_4870,
  335:            <<"-undef(foo).
  336:            ">>,
  337:            []}],
  338:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: %% crashing erl_scan
  342: otp_4871(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  344:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_4871.erl"),
  345:     ok = file:write_file(File, "-module(otp_4871)."),
  346:     %% Testing crash in erl_scan. Unfortunately there currently is
  347:     %% no known way to crash erl_scan so it is emulated by killing the
  348:     %% file io server. This assumes lots of things about how
  349:     %% the processes are started and how monitors are set up,
  350:     %% so there are some sanity checks before killing.
  351:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  352:     timer:sleep(1),
  353:     true = current_module(Epp, epp),
  354:     {monitored_by,[Io]} = process_info(Epp, monitored_by),
  355:     true = current_module(Io, file_io_server),
  356:     exit(Io, emulate_crash),
  357:     timer:sleep(1),
  358:     {error,{_Line,epp,cannot_parse}} = otp_4871_parse_file(Epp),
  359:     epp:close(Epp),
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: current_module(Pid, Mod) ->
  363:     {current_function, {Mod, _, _}} = process_info(Pid, current_function),
  364:     true.
  365: 
  366: otp_4871_parse_file(Epp) ->
  367:     case epp:parse_erl_form(Epp) of
  368: 	{ok,_} -> otp_4871_parse_file(Epp);
  369: 	Other -> Other
  370:     end.
  371: 
  372: %% OTP-5362. The -file attribute is recognized.
  373: otp_5362(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  374:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  375: 
  376:     Copts = [return, strong_validation,{i,Dir}],
  377: 
  378:     File_Incl = filename:join(Dir, "incl_5362.erl"),
  379:     File_Incl2 = filename:join(Dir, "incl2_5362.erl"),
  380:     File_Incl3 = filename:join(Dir, "incl3_5362.erl"),
  381:     Incl = <<"-module(incl_5362).
  382: 
  383:               -include(\"incl2_5362.erl\").
  384: 
  385:               -include_lib(\"incl3_5362.erl\").
  386: 
  387:               hi(There) -> % line 7
  388:                    a.
  389:            ">>,
  390:     Incl2 = <<"-file(\"some.file\", 100).
  391: 
  392:                foo(Bar) -> % line 102
  393:                    foo.
  394:             ">>,
  395:     Incl3 = <<"glurk(Foo) -> % line 1
  396:                   bar.
  397:             ">>,
  398:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl, Incl),
  399:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl2, Incl2),
  400:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl3, Incl3),
  401: 
  402:     {ok, incl_5362, InclWarnings} = compile:file(File_Incl, Copts),
  403:     true = message_compare(
  404:                    [{File_Incl3,[{{1,1},erl_lint,{unused_function,{glurk,1}}},
  405:                                  {{1,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Foo'}}]},
  406:                     {File_Incl,[{{7,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{hi,1}}},
  407:                                 {{7,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'There'}}]},
  408:                     {"some.file",[{{102,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{foo,1}}},
  409:                                   {{102,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Bar'}}]}],
  410:                    lists:usort(InclWarnings)),
  411: 
  412:     file:delete(File_Incl),
  413:     file:delete(File_Incl2),
  414:     file:delete(File_Incl3),
  415: 
  416:     %% A -file attribute referring back to the including file.
  417:     File_Back = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.erl"),
  418:     File_Back_hrl = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.hrl"),
  419:     Back = <<"-module(back_5362).
  420: 
  421:               -export([foo/1]).
  422: 
  423:               -file(?FILE, 1).
  424:               -include(\"back_5362.hrl\").
  425: 
  426:               foo(V) -> % line 4
  427:                   bar.
  428:               ">>,
  429:     Back_hrl = [<<"
  430:                   -file(\"">>,File_Back,<<"\", 2).
  431:                  ">>],
  432: 
  433:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back, Back),
  434:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back_hrl, list_to_binary(Back_hrl)),
  435: 
  436:     {ok, back_5362, BackWarnings} = compile:file(File_Back, Copts),
  437:     true = message_compare(
  438:                    [{File_Back,[{{4,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'V'}}]}],
  439:                    BackWarnings),
  440:     file:delete(File_Back),
  441:     file:delete(File_Back_hrl),
  442: 
  443:     %% Set filename but keep line.
  444:     File_Change = filename:join(Dir, "change_5362.erl"),
  445:     Change = [<<"-module(change_5362).
  446: 
  447:                 -file(?FILE, 100).
  448: 
  449:                 -export([foo/1,bar/1]).
  450: 
  451:                 -file(\"other.file\", ?LINE). % like an included file...
  452:                 foo(A) -> % line 105
  453:                     bar.
  454: 
  455:                 -file(\"">>,File_Change,<<"\", 1000).
  456: 
  457:                 bar(B) -> % line 1002
  458:                     foo.
  459:               ">>],
  460: 
  461:     ok = file:write_file(File_Change, list_to_binary(Change)),
  462: 
  463:     {ok, change_5362, ChangeWarnings} =
  464:         compile:file(File_Change, Copts),
  465:     true = message_compare(
  466:                    [{File_Change,[{{1002,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]},
  467:                     {"other.file",[{{105,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}],
  468:                    lists:usort(ChangeWarnings)),
  469: 
  470:     file:delete(File_Change),
  471: 
  472:     %% -file attribute ending with a blank (not a newline).
  473:     File_Blank = filename:join(Dir, "blank_5362.erl"),
  474: 
  475:     Blank = <<"-module(blank_5362).
  476: 
  477:                -export([q/1,a/1,b/1,c/1]).
  478: 
  479:                -
  480:                file(?FILE, 18). q(Q) -> foo. % line 18
  481: 
  482:                a(A) -> % line 20
  483:                    1.
  484: 
  485:                -file(?FILE, 42).
  486: 
  487:                b(B) -> % line 44
  488:                    2.
  489: 
  490:                -file(?FILE, ?LINE). c(C) -> % line 47
  491:                    3.
  492:             ">>,
  493:     ok = file:write_file(File_Blank, Blank),
  494:     {ok, blank_5362, BlankWarnings} = compile:file(File_Blank, Copts),
  495:     true = message_compare(
  496:              [{File_Blank,[{{18,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}},
  497:                            {{20,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}},
  498:                            {{44,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  499:                            {{47,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C'}}]}],
  500:               lists:usort(BlankWarnings)),
  501:     file:delete(File_Blank),
  502: 
  503:     %% __FILE__ is set by inclusion and by -file attribute
  504:     FILE_incl = filename:join(Dir, "file_5362.erl"),
  505:     FILE_incl1 = filename:join(Dir, "file_incl_5362.erl"),
  506:     FILE = <<"-module(file_5362).
  507: 
  508:               -export([ff/0, ii/0]).
  509: 
  510:               -include(\"file_incl_5362.erl\").
  511: 
  512:               -file(\"other_file\", 100).
  513: 
  514:               ff() ->
  515:                   ?FILE.">>,
  516:     FILE1 = <<"ii() -> ?FILE.
  517:               ">>,
  518:     FILE_Mod = file_5362,
  519:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl, FILE),
  520:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl1, FILE1),
  521:     FILE_Copts = [return, {i,Dir},{outdir,Dir}],
  522:     {ok, file_5362, []} = compile:file(FILE_incl, FILE_Copts),
  523:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(FILE_incl, ".erl"),
  524:     {module, FILE_Mod} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, FILE_Mod),
  525:     II = FILE_Mod:ii(),
  526:     "file_incl_5362.erl" = filename:basename(II),
  527:     FF = FILE_Mod:ff(),
  528:     "other_file" = filename:basename(FF),
  529:     code:purge(file_5362),
  530: 
  531:     file:delete(FILE_incl),
  532:     file:delete(FILE_incl1),
  533: 
  534:     ok.
  535: 
  536: pmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  537:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  538:     Pmod = filename:join(DataDir, "pmod.erl"),
  539:     case epp:parse_file([Pmod], [], []) of
  540: 	      {ok,Forms} ->
  541: 		  %% io:format("~p\n", [Forms]),
  542: 		  [] = [F || {error,_}=F <- Forms],
  543: 		  ok
  544: 	  end,
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: not_circular(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     %% Used to generate a compilation error, wrongly saying that it
  549:     %% was a circular definition.
  550: 
  551:     Ts = [{circular_1,
  552:            <<"-define(S(S), ??S).\n"
  553:              "t() -> \"string\" = ?S(string), ok.\n">>,
  554:            ok}],
  555:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  556:     ok.
  557: 
  558: %% Skip some bytes in the beginning of the file.
  559: skip_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  561:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "epp_test_skip_header.erl"]),
  562:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  563: 			       <<"some bytes
  564:                                   in the beginning of the file
  565:                                   that should be skipped
  566:                                   -module(epp_test_skip_header).
  567:                                   -export([main/1]).
  568: 
  569:                                   main(_) -> ?MODULE.
  570: 
  571:                                   ">>),
  572:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  573:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  574:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  575:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  576:     {ok, Epp} = epp:open([{fd, Fd}, {name, list_to_atom(File)}, {location, 4}]),
  577: 
  578:     Forms = epp:parse_file(Epp),
  579:     [] = [Reason || {error, Reason} <- Forms],
  580:     ok = epp:close(Epp),
  581:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  582: 
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: %% ?MODULE before module declaration.
  586: otp_6277(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     Ts = [{otp_6277,
  588:            <<"-undef(ASSERT).
  589:               -define(ASSERT, ?MODULE).
  590: 
  591:               ?ASSERT().">>,
  592:            [{error,{4,epp,{undefined,'MODULE', none}}}]}],
  593:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  594:     ok.
  595: 
  596: %% Test -ifdef(MODULE) before module declaration. Should not be
  597: %% considered defined.
  598: gh_4995(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     Ts = [{gh_4995,
  600:            <<"-ifdef(MODULE).
  601:               -record(r, {x = ?MODULE}).
  602:               -endif.">>,
  603:            []}],
  604:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  605:     ok.
  606:

  608: otp_7702(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  609:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  610:     File = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.erl"),
  611:     Contents = <<"-module(file_7702).
  612: 
  613:                   -export([t/0]).
  614: 
  615:                   -define(RECEIVE(Msg,Body),
  616:                        receive
  617:                            Msg -> Body;
  618:                            M ->
  619:                 exit({unexpected_message,M,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  620:                        after 10000 ->
  621:                             exit({timeout,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  622:                        end).
  623:                    t() ->
  624:                        ?RECEIVE(foo, bar).">>,
  625:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents),
  626:     {ok, file_7702, []} =
  627:         compile:file(File, [debug_info,return,{outdir,Dir}]),
  628:

  631:

  633:     Forms2 = unopaque_forms(Forms),
  634:         [{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
  635:          _,
  636:          _,

  640:               [_,

  643:                 [],
  644:                 [{_,_,_,

  646:                     [{atom,{14,38},unexpected_message},

  664:     file:delete(BeamFile),

  899:                     {{3,19},epp,{undefined,'A',none}}],[]}}
  900: 
  901:           ],

  903: 
  904:     Cks = [{otp_check_1,
  905:             <<"\n-include_lib(\"epp_test.erl\").\n">>,
  906:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include_lib"}}}]},
  907: 
  908:            {otp_check_2,
  909:             <<"\n-include(\"epp_test.erl\").\n">>,
  910:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include"}}}]}
  911:            ],
  912:     [] = check(Config, Cks),
  913: 
  914:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  915:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8130.erl"),
  916:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  917:                                "-module(otp_8130).\n"
  918:                                "-define(a, 3.14).\n"
  919:                                "t() -> ?a.\n"),
  920:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  921:     PreDefMacs = macs(Epp),
  922:     ['BASE_MODULE','BASE_MODULE_STRING','BEAM',
  923:      'FEATURE_AVAILABLE', 'FEATURE_ENABLED','FILE',
  924:      'FUNCTION_ARITY','FUNCTION_NAME',
  925:      'LINE','MACHINE','MODULE','MODULE_STRING',
  926:      'OTP_RELEASE'] = PreDefMacs,
  927:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,file}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  928:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,module}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  929:     {ok,[{atom,_,t}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  930:     {eof,_} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  931:     [a] = macs(Epp) -- PreDefMacs,
  932:     epp:close(Epp),
  933: 
  934:     %% escript
  935:     ModuleStr = "any_name",
  936:     Module = list_to_atom(ModuleStr),
  937:     fun() ->
  938:             PreDefMacros = [{'MODULE', Module, redefine},
  939:                             {'MODULE_STRING', ModuleStr, redefine},
  940:                             a, {b,2}],
  941:             {ok,Epp2} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros),
  942:             [{atom,_,true}] = macro(Epp2, a),
  943:             [{integer,_,2}] = macro(Epp2, b),
  944:             false = macro(Epp2, c),
  945:             epp:close(Epp2)
  946:     end(),
  947:     fun() ->
  948:             PreDefMacros = [{a,b,c}],
  949:             {error,{bad,{a,b,c}}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  950:     end(),
  951:     fun() ->
  952:             PreDefMacros = [a, {a,1}],
  953:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  954:     end(),
  955:     fun() ->
  956:             PreDefMacros = [{a,1},a],
  957:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  958:     end(),
  959: 
  960:     {error,enoent} = epp:open("no such file", []),
  961:     {error,enoent} = epp:parse_file("no such file", [], []),
  962: 
  963:     _ = ifdef(Config),
  964: 
  965:     ok.
  966: 
  967: scan_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  968:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  969:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
  970: 
  971:     {ok, Toks, [{encoding, _}]} = epp:scan_file(File, []),
  972:     [FileForm1, ModuleForm, ExportForm,
  973:      FileForm2, FileForm3, FunctionForm,
  974:      {eof,_}] = Toks,
  975:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm1,
  976:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,module}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ModuleForm,
  977:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,export}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ExportForm,
  978:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm2,
  979:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm3,
  980:     [{atom,_,ok}, {'(',_} | _]               = FunctionForm,
  981:     ok.
  982: 
  983: macs(Epp) ->
  984:     Macros = epp:macro_defs(Epp), % not documented
  985:     lists:sort([MName || {{atom,MName},_} <- Macros]).
  986: 
  987: macro(Epp, N) ->
  988:     case lists:keyfind({atom,N}, 1, epp:macro_defs(Epp)) of
  989:         false -> false;
  990:         {{atom,N},{_,V}} -> V;
  991:         {{atom,N},Defs} -> lists:append([V || {_,{_,V}} <- Defs])
  992:     end.
  993: 
  994: ifdef(Config) ->
  995:     Cs = [{ifdef_c1,
  996:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  997:              "a bug.\n"
  998:              "-else.\n"
  999:              "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1000:              "a bug.\n"
 1001:              "-endif.\n"
 1002:              "-else.\n"
 1003:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1004:              "-endif.">>,
 1005:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
 1006: 
 1007:           {ifdef_c2,
 1008:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
 1009:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
 1010:              "a bug.\n"
 1011:              "-endif.">>,
 1012:            {errors,[{{3,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","bug"]}],[]}},
 1013: 
 1014:           {ifdef_c3,
 1015:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
 1016:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
 1017:              "-endif">>,
 1018: 
 1019:            {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
 1020:                     {{3,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],
 1021:           []}},
 1022: 
 1023:           {ifdef_c4,
 1024:            <<"\n-ifdef a.\n"
 1025:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1026:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,ifdef}}],[]}},
 1027: 
 1028:           {ifdef_c5,
 1029:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1030:              "-else.\n"
 1031:              "-endif.\n"
 1032:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1033:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",endif}}],[]}},
 1034: 
 1035:           {ifdef_c6,
 1036:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1037:              "-else.\n"
 1038:              "-endif.\n"
 1039:              "-else.\n">>,
 1040:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'else'}}],[]}},
 1041:

 1043:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1044:              "-else\n"
 1045:              "foo bar\n"
 1046:              "-else.\n"
 1047:              "t() -> a.\n"
 1048:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1049:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,{bad,'else'}}],[]}},
 1050:

 1052:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1053:               "-foo bar.">>,
 1054:            {errors,[{{2,10},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],[]}},

 1057:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1058:               "3.3e12000.\n"
 1059:               "-endif.\n">>,
 1060:            []},
 1061: 
 1062:           {ifdef_c10,
 1063:            <<"\nt() -> 3.3e12000.\n">>,
 1064:            {errors,[{{2,8},erl_scan,{illegal,float}},
 1065:                     {{2,17},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}], % ...
 1066:             []}},
 1067: 
 1068:           {ifndef_c1,
 1069:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1070:              "-ifndef(A).\n"
 1071:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1072:              "-endif.\n"
 1073:              "-else.\n"
 1074:              "a bug.\n"
 1075:              "-else.\n"
 1076:              "a bug.\n"
 1077:              "-endif.">>,
 1078:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},

 1081:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1082:              "-endif">>,

 1097:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),

 1180: %% OTP-12847: Test the -error directive.
 1181: test_error(Config) ->
 1182:     Cs = [{error_c1,
 1183:            <<"-error(\"string and macro: \" ?MODULE_STRING).\n"
 1184: 	     "-ifdef(NOT_DEFINED).\n"
 1185: 	     " -error(\"this one will be skipped\").\n"
 1186: 	     "-endif.\n">>,

 1189: 	  {error_c2,
 1190: 	   <<"-ifdef(CONFIG_A).\n"
 1191: 	     " t() -> a.\n"
 1192: 	     "-else.\n"
 1193: 	     "-ifdef(CONFIG_B).\n"
 1194: 	     " t() -> b.\n"
 1195: 	     "-else.\n"
 1196: 	     "-error(\"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available\").\n"
 1197: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1198: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1199: 	   {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{error,"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available"}}],[]}},
 1200: 
 1201: 	  {error_c3,
 1202: 	   <<"-error(a b c).\n">>,
 1203: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,error}}],[]}}
 1204: 
 1205: 	 ],

 1240: %% OTP-12847: Test the -if and -elif directives and the built-in
 1241: %% function defined(Symbol).
 1242: test_if(Config) ->
 1243:     Cs = [{if_1c,
 1244: 	   <<"-if.\n"
 1245: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1246: 	     "-if no_parentheses.\n"
 1247: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1248: 	     "-if(syntax error.\n"
 1249: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1250: 	     "-if(true).\n"
 1251: 	     "-if(a+3).\n"
 1252: 	     "syntax error not triggered here.\n"
 1253: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1254:            {errors,[{{1,23},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1255: 		    {{3,5},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1256: 		    {{5,12},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","error"]},
 1257: 		    {{11,1},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",'if'}}],
 1258: 	    []}},
 1259: 
 1260: 	  {if_2c,			       	%Bad guard expressions.
 1261: 	   <<"-if(is_list(integer_to_list(42))).\n" %Not guard BIF.
 1262: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1263: 	     "-if(begin true end).\n"
 1264: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1265: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1266: 		    {{3,2},epp,{bad,'if'}}],
 1267: 	    []}},
 1268: 
 1269: 	  {if_3c,			       	%Invalid use of defined/1.
 1270: 	   <<"-if defined(42).\n"
 1271: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1272: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1273: 
 1274: 	  {if_4c,
 1275: 	   <<"-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n">>,
 1276: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1277: 
 1278: 	  {if_5c,
 1279: 	   <<"-ifdef(not_defined_today).\n"
 1280: 	     "-else.\n"
 1281: 	     "-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n"
 1282: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1283: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1284: 
 1285: 	  {if_6c,
 1286: 	   <<"-if(defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1287: 	     "-else.\n"
 1288: 	     "-elif(true).\n"
 1289: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1290: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,elif_after_else}],[]}},
 1291: 
 1292: 	  {if_7c,
 1293: 	   <<"-if(begin true end).\n"		%Not a guard expression.
 1294: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1295: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1296: 
 1297: 	  {if_8c,
 1298: 	   <<"-if(?foo).\n"                     %Undefined symbol.
 1299: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1300: 	   {errors,[{{1,25},epp,{undefined,foo,none}}],[]}},
 1301: 
 1302: 	  {if_9c,
 1303: 	   <<"-if(not_builtin()).\n"
 1304: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1305: 	     "-else.\n"
 1306: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1307: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1308: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}}
 1309: 	 ],
 1310:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1311: 
 1312:     Ts = [{if_1,
 1313: 	   <<"-if(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1314: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1315: 	     "-else.\n"
 1316: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1317: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1318:            ok},
 1319: 
 1320: 	  {if_2,
 1321: 	   <<"-if(false).\n"
 1322: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1323: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1324: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1325: 	     "-else.\n"
 1326: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1327: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1328:            ok},
 1329: 
 1330: 	  {if_3,
 1331: 	   <<"-if(true).\n"
 1332: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1333: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1334: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1335: 	     "-else.\n"
 1336: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1337: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1338:            ok},
 1339: 
 1340: 	  {if_4,
 1341: 	   <<"-define(a, 1).\n"
 1342: 	     "-if(defined(a) andalso defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1343: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1344: 	     "-else.\n"
 1345: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1346: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1347:            ok},
 1348: 
 1349: 	  {if_5,
 1350: 	   <<"-if(defined(a)).\n"
 1351: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1352: 	     "-else.\n"
 1353: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1354: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1355:            ok},
 1356:

 1358: 	   <<"-if(defined(not_defined_today)).\n"
 1359: 	     " -if(true).\n"
 1360: 	     "  bug1.\n"
 1361: 	     " -elif(true).\n"
 1362: 	     "  bug2.\n"
 1363: 	     " -elif(true).\n"
 1364: 	     "  bug3.\n"
 1365: 	     " -else.\n"
 1366: 	     "  bug4.\n"
 1367: 	     " -endif.\n"
 1368: 	     "-else.\n"
 1369: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1370: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1371:            ok},
 1372:

 1374: 	   <<"-if(42).\n"			%Not boolean.
 1375: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1376: 	     "-else.\n"
 1377: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1378: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1379: 	   ok}
 1380: 	 ],

 1385: %% Advanced test on overloading macros.
 1386: overload_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1387:     Cs = [
 1388:           %% '-undef' removes all definitions of a macro
 1389:           {overload_mac_c1,
 1390:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1391:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1392:             "-undef(A).\n"
 1393:             "t1() -> ?A.\n",
 1394:             "t2() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1395:            {errors,[{{4,10},epp,{undefined,'A', none}},
 1396:                     {{5,10},epp,{undefined,'A', 1}}],[]}},
 1397: 
 1398:           %% cannot overload predefined macros
 1399:           {overload_mac_c2,
 1400:            <<"\n-define(MODULE(X), X).">>,
 1401:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'MODULE'}}],[]}},
 1402: 
 1403:           %% cannot overload macros with same arity
 1404:           {overload_mac_c3,
 1405:            <<"-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1406:             "-define(A(Y), Y).">>,
 1407:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine,'A'}}],[]}},
 1408: 
 1409:           {overload_mac_c4,
 1410:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1411:             "-define(A(X,Y), {X,Y}).\n"
 1412:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1413:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1414:            {errors,[{{4,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}}
 1415:          ],
 1416:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1417: 
 1418:     Ts = [
 1419:           {overload_mac_r1,
 1420:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1421:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1422:             "-define(A(X, Y), {X, Y}).\n"
 1423:             "t() -> {?A, ?A(2), ?A(3, 4)}.">>,
 1424:            {1, 2, {3, 4}}},
 1425: 
 1426:           {overload_mac_r2,
 1427:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1428:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1429:             "t() -> ?A(?A).">>,
 1430:            1},
 1431: 
 1432:           {overload_mac_r3,
 1433:            <<"-define(A, ?B).\n"
 1434:             "-define(B, a).\n"
 1435:             "-define(B(X), {b,X}).\n"
 1436:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1437:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1438:            1}
 1439:           ],
 1440:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 1441:

 1443: %% OTP-8388. More tests on overloaded macros.
 1444: otp_8388(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1445:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1446:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8388.erl"),
 1447:     ok = file:write_file(File, <<"-module(otp_8388)."
 1448:                                        "-define(LINE, a).">>),
 1449:     fun() ->
 1450:             PreDefMacros = [{'LINE', a}],
 1451:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1452:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1453:     end(),
 1454: 
 1455:     fun() ->
 1456:             PreDefMacros = ['LINE'],
 1457:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1458:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1459:     end(),
 1460: 
 1461:     Ts = [
 1462:           {macro_1,
 1463:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1464:              "t() -> ?m(,).\n">>,
 1465:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1466:           {macro_2,
 1467:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1468:              "t() -> ?m(a,).\n">>,
 1469:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1470:           {macro_3,
 1471:            <<"\n-define(LINE, a).\n">>,
 1472:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}}],[]}},
 1473:           {macro_4,
 1474:            <<"-define(A(B, C, D), {B,C,D}).\n"
 1475:              "t() -> ?A(a,,3).\n">>,
 1476:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}},
 1477:           {macro_5,
 1478:            <<"-define(Q, {?F0(), ?F1(,,4)}).\n">>,
 1479:            {errors,[{{1,40},epp,{arg_error,'F1'}}],[]}},
 1480:           {macro_6,
 1481:            <<"-define(FOO(X), ?BAR(X)).\n"
 1482:              "-define(BAR(X), ?FOO(X)).\n"
 1483:              "-undef(FOO).\n"
 1484:              "test() -> ?BAR(1).\n">>,
 1485:            {errors,[{{4,12},epp,{undefined,'FOO',1}}],[]}}
 1486:          ],
 1487:     [] = compile(Config, Ts),
 1488:     ok.

 1513: %% OTP-8911. -file and file inclusion bug.
 1514: otp_8911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1515:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1516: 	true ->
 1517: 	    {skip, "Testing cover, so cannot run when cover is already running"};
 1518: 	false ->
 1519: 	    do_otp_8911(Config)
 1520:     end.
 1521: do_otp_8911(Config) ->
 1522:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1523:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1524: 
 1525:     File = "i.erl",
 1526:     Cont = <<"-module(i).
 1527:               -export([t/0]).
 1528:               -file(\"fil1\", 100).
 1529:               -include(\"i1.erl\").
 1530:               t() ->
 1531:                   a.
 1532:            ">>,
 1533:     ok = file:write_file(File, Cont),
 1534:     Incl = <<"-file(\"fil2\", 35).
 1535:               t1() ->
 1536:                   b.
 1537:            ">>,
 1538:     File1 = "i1.erl",
 1539:     ok = file:write_file(File1, Incl),
 1540: 
 1541:     {ok, i} = cover:compile(File),
 1542:     a = i:t(),
 1543:     {ok,[{{i,6},1}]} = cover:analyse(i, calls, line),
 1544:     cover:stop(),
 1545: 
 1546:     file:delete(File),
 1547:     file:delete(File1),
 1548:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1549:     ok.
 1550:

 1554:            <<"\n-define(A, a)\n">>,
 1555:            {errors,[{{2,13},epp,premature_end}],[]}}
 1556:          ],
 1557:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1558:     ok.

 1560: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1561: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1562:     %% Two messages (one too many). Keeps otp_4871 happy.
 1563:     Cs = [{otp_10302,
 1564:            <<"%% coding: utf-8\n \n \x{E4}">>,
 1565:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,cannot_parse},
 1566:                     {{3,1},file_io_server,invalid_unicode}],[]}}
 1567:          ],
 1568:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1569:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1570:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_10302.erl"),
 1571:     utf8 = encoding("coding: utf-8", File),
 1572:     utf8 = encoding("coding: UTF-8", File),
 1573:     latin1 = encoding("coding: Latin-1", File),
 1574:     latin1 = encoding("coding: latin-1", File),
 1575:     none = encoding_com("coding: utf-8", File),
 1576:     none = encoding_com("\n\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1577:     none = encoding_nocom("\n\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1578:     utf8 = encoding_com("\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1579:     utf8 = encoding_nocom("\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1580:     none = encoding("coding: \nutf-8", File),
 1581:     latin1 = encoding("Encoding :  latin-1", File),
 1582:     utf8 = encoding("ccoding: UTF-8", File),
 1583:     utf8 = encoding("coding= utf-8", File),
 1584:     utf8 = encoding_com(" %% coding= utf-8", File),
 1585:     utf8 = encoding("coding  =  utf-8", File),
 1586:     none = encoding("coding: utf-16 coding: utf-8", File), %first is bad
 1587:     none = encoding("Coding: utf-8", File),    %capital c
 1588:     utf8 = encoding("-*- coding: utf-8 -*-", File),
 1589:     utf8 = encoding("-*-coding= utf-8-*-", File),
 1590:     utf8 = encoding("codingcoding= utf-8", File),
 1591:     ok = prefix("coding: utf-8", File, utf8),
 1592: 
 1593:     "coding: latin-1" = epp:encoding_to_string(latin1),
 1594:     "coding: utf-8" = epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),
 1595:     true = lists:member(epp:default_encoding(), [latin1, utf8]),
 1596: 
 1597:     ok.
 1598: 
 1599: prefix(S, File, Enc) ->
 1600:     prefix(0, S, File, Enc).
 1601: 
 1602: prefix(100, _S, _File, _) ->
 1603:     ok;
 1604: prefix(N, S, File, Enc) ->
 1605:     Enc = encoding(lists:duplicate(N, $\s) ++ S, File),
 1606:     prefix(N+1, S, File, Enc).
 1607: 
 1608: encoding(Enc, File) ->
 1609:     E = encoding_com("%% " ++ Enc, File),
 1610:     none = encoding_com(Enc, File),
 1611:     E = encoding_nocom(Enc, File).
 1612: 
 1613: encoding_com(Enc, File) ->
 1614:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1615:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B),
 1616:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1617:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1618:     E = epp:set_encoding(Fd),
 1619:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1620:     E = epp:read_encoding(File).
 1621: 
 1622: encoding_nocom(Enc, File) ->
 1623:     Options = [{in_comment_only, false}],
 1624:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1625:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B, Options),
 1626:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1627:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1628:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1629:     E = epp:read_encoding(File, Options).
 1630: 
 1631: %% OTP-10820. Unicode filenames.
 1632: otp_10820(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1633:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1634:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1635:     File = filename:join(Dir, L++".erl"),
 1636:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1637:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1638:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1639:     C2 = <<"\n-module(any).">>,
 1640:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1641:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1642: 
 1643: do_otp_10820(File, C, PC) ->
 1644:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1645:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [File, C]),
 1646:     {ok, Forms} = rpc:call(Node, epp, parse_file, [File, [],[]]),
 1647:     [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
 1648:      {attribute,2,module,any},
 1649:      {eof,2}] = unopaque_forms(Forms),
 1650:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1651:     ok.
 1652: 
 1653: %% OTP_14285: Unicode atoms.
 1654: otp_14285(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1655:     %% This is just a sample of errors.
 1656:     Cs = [{otp_14285,
 1657:            <<"-export([f/0]).
 1658:               -define('a\x{400}b', 'a\x{400}d').
 1659:               f() ->
 1660:                   ?'a\x{400}b'.
 1661:               g() ->
 1662:                   ?\"a\x{400}b\".
 1663:               h() ->
 1664:                   ?'a\x{400}no'().
 1665:               "/utf8>>,
 1666:            {errors,[{{6,20},epp,{call,[63,[91,["97",44,"1024",44,"98"],93]]}},
 1667:                     {{8,20},epp,{undefined,'a\x{400}no',0}}],
 1668:             []}}
 1669:          ],
 1670:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1671:     ok.
 1672: 
 1673: %% OTP-11728. Bugfix circular macro.
 1674: otp_11728(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1675:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1676:     H = <<"-define(MACRO,[[]++?MACRO]).">>,
 1677:     HrlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.hrl"),
 1678:     ok = file:write_file(HrlFile, H),
 1679:     C = <<"-module(otp_11728).
 1680:            -export([function_name/0]).
 1681: 
 1682:            -include(\"otp_11728.hrl\").
 1683: 
 1684:            function_name()->
 1685:                A=?MACRO, % line 7
 1686:                ok">>,
 1687:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.erl"),
 1688:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C),
 1689:     {ok, L} = epp:parse_file(ErlFile, [Dir], []),
 1690:     true = lists:member({error,{7,epp,{circular,'MACRO',none}}}, L),
 1691:     _ = file:delete(HrlFile),
 1692:     _ = file:delete(ErlFile),
 1693:     ok.
 1694: 
 1695: %% Check the new API for setting the default encoding.
 1696: encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1697:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1698:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "encoding.erl"),
 1699: 
 1700:     %% Try a latin-1 file with no encoding given.
 1701:     C1 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1702:            %% ",246,"
 1703: 	  ">>,
 1704:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C1),
 1705:     {ok,[{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
 1706: 	 {attribute,{1,2},module,encoding},
 1707: 	 {error,_},
 1708: 	 {error,{{2,12},epp,cannot_parse}},
 1709: 	 {eof,{2,12}}]} = epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{location, {1,1}}]),
 1710:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1711: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1712: 	 {eof,3}]} =
 1713: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1714:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1715: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1716: 	 {eof,3}],Extra0} =
 1717: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1718:     none = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra0),
 1719: 
 1720:     %% Try a latin-1 file with encoding given in a comment.
 1721:     C2 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1722:            %% encoding: latin-1
 1723:            %% ",246,"
 1724: 	  ">>,
 1725:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C2),
 1726:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1727: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1728: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1729: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, []),
 1730:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1731: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1732: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1733: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1734:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1735: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1736: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1737: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8}]),
 1738:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1739: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1740: 	 {eof,4}],Extra1} =
 1741: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [extra]),
 1742:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra1),
 1743: 
 1744:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1745: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1746: 	 {eof,4}],Extra2} =
 1747: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1748:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra2),
 1749:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1750: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1751: 	 {eof,4}],Extra3} =
 1752: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8},extra]),
 1753:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra3),
 1754:     ok.
 1755: 
 1756: extends(Config) ->
 1757:     Cs = [{extends_c1,
 1758: 	   <<"-extends(some.other.module).\n">>,
 1759: 	   {errors,[{{1,33},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}],[]}}],
 1760:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1761: 
 1762:     Ts = [{extends_1,
 1763: 	   <<"-extends(some_other_module).\n"
 1764: 	     "t() -> {?BASE_MODULE,?BASE_MODULE_STRING}.\n">>,
 1765: 	   {some_other_module,"some_other_module"}}],
 1766: 
 1767:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1768:     ok.
 1769: 
 1770: function_macro(Config) ->
 1771:     Cs = [{f_c1,
 1772: 	   <<"-define(FUNCTION_NAME, a).\n"
 1773: 	     "-define(FUNCTION_ARITY, a).\n"
 1774: 	     "-define(FS,\n"
 1775: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1776: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1777: 	     "-attr({f,?FUNCTION_NAME}).\n"
 1778: 	     "-attr2(?FS).\n"
 1779: 	     "-file(?FUNCTION_ARITY, 1).\n"
 1780: 	     "f1() ?FUNCTION_NAME/?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1781: 	     "f2(?FUNCTION_NAME.\n">>,
 1782: 	   {errors,[{{1,28},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1783: 		    {{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1784: 		    {{6,11},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1785: 		    {{7,9},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1786: 		    {{8,8},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1787: 		    {{9,7},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","f1"]},
 1788: 		    {{10,18},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}],
 1789: 	    []}},
 1790: 
 1791: 	  {f_c2,
 1792: 	   <<"a({a) -> ?FUNCTION_NAME.\n"
 1793: 	     "b(}{) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1794: 	     "c(?FUNCTION_NAME, ?not_defined) -> ok.\n">>,
 1795: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","')'"]},
 1796: 		    {{2,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'}'"]},
 1797: 		    {{3,20},epp,{undefined,not_defined,none}}],
 1798: 	    []}},
 1799: 
 1800: 	  {f_c3,
 1801: 	   <<"?FUNCTION_NAME() -> ok.\n"
 1802: 	     "?FUNCTION_ARITY() -> ok.\n">>,
 1803: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1804: 		    {{2,2},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}}],
 1805: 	    []}}
 1806: 	 ],
 1807: 
 1808:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1809: 
 1810:     Ts = [{f_1,
 1811: 	   <<"t() -> {a,0} = a(), {b,1} = b(1), {c,2} = c(1, 2),\n"
 1812: 	     "  {d,1} = d({d,1}), {foo,1} = foo(foo), ok.\n"
 1813: 	     "a() -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1814: 	     "b(_) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1815: 	     "c(_, (_)) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1816: 	     "d({?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}=F) -> F.\n"
 1817: 	     "-define(FOO, foo).\n"
 1818: 	     "?FOO(?FOO) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n">>,
 1819: 	   ok},
 1820: 
 1821: 	  {f_2,
 1822: 	   <<"t() ->\n"
 1823:              "  A = {a,[<<0:24>>,#{a=>1,b=>2}]},\n"
 1824: 	     "  1 = a(A),\n"
 1825: 	     "  ok.\n"
 1826: 	     "a({a,[<<_,_,_>>,#{a:=1,b:=2}]}) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n">>,
 1827: 	   ok},
 1828: 
 1829: 	  {f_3,
 1830: 	   <<"-define(FS,\n"
 1831: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1832: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1833: 	     "t() ->\n"
 1834: 	     "  {t,0} = {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY},\n"
 1835: 	     "  \"t/0\" = ?FS,\n"
 1836: 	     "  ok.\n">>,
 1837: 	   ok},
 1838: 
 1839: 	  {f_4,
 1840: 	   <<"-define(__, _, _).\n"
 1841: 	     "-define(FF, ?FUNCTION_NAME, ?FUNCTION_ARITY).\n"
 1842: 	     "a(?__) -> 2 = ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1843: 	     "b(?FUNCTION_ARITY, ?__) -> ok.\n"
 1844: 	     "c(?FF) -> ok.\n"
 1845: 	     "t() -> a(1, 2), b(3, 1, 2), c(c, 2), ok.\n">>,
 1846: 	   ok}
 1847: 	 ],
 1848:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1849: 
 1850:     ok.
 1851: 
 1852: source_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1853:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1854:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
 1855: 
 1856:     source_name_1(File, "/test/gurka.erl"),
 1857:     source_name_1(File, "gaffel.erl"),
 1858: 
 1859:     ok.
 1860: 
 1861: source_name_1(File, Expected) ->
 1862:     Res = epp:parse_file(File, [{source_name, Expected}]),
 1863:     {ok, [{attribute,_,file,{Expected,_}} | _Forms]} = Res.
 1864: 
 1865: otp_16978(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1866:     %% A test of erl_parse:tokens().
 1867:     P = <<"t() -> ?a.">>,
 1868:     Vs = [#{},
 1869:           #{k => 1,[[a],[{}]] => "str"},
 1870:           #{#{} => [{#{x=>#{3=>$3}}},{3.14,#{}}]}],
 1871:     Ts = [{erl_parse_tokens,
 1872:            P,
 1873:            [{d,{a,V}}],
 1874:            V} || V <- Vs],
 1875:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1876: 
 1877:     ok.

 2098:     ok.
 2099: 
 2100: %% Start location is 1.
 2101: check(Config, Tests) ->
 2102:     eval_tests(Config, fun check_test/3, Tests).
 2103: 
 2104: %% Start location is {1,1}.
 2105: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 2106:     eval_tests(Config, fun compile_test/3, Tests).
 2107: 
 2108: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2109:     eval_tests(Config, fun run_test/3, Tests).
 2110: 
 2111: eval_tests(Config, Fun, Tests) ->
 2112:     TestsWithOpts =
 2113:         [case Test of
 2114:              {N,P,E} ->
 2115:                  {N,P,[],E};
 2116:              {_,_,_,_} ->
 2117:                  Test
 2118:          end || Test <- Tests],
 2119:     F = fun({N,P,Opts,E}, BadL) ->
 2120:                 %% io:format("Testing ~p~n", [P]),
 2121:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, Opts),
 2122:                 %% The result should be the same when enabling maybe ... end
 2123:                 %% (making 'else' a keyword instead of an atom).
 2124:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}|Opts]),
 2125:                 case message_compare(E, Return) of
 2126:                     true ->
 2127:                         case E of
 2128:                             {errors, Errors} ->
 2129:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2130:                             _ ->
 2131:                                 ok
 2132:                         end,
 2133:                         BadL;
 2134:                     false ->
 2135:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2136:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Return]),
 2137: 			fail()
 2138:                 end
 2139:         end,
 2140:     lists:foldl(F, [], TestsWithOpts).
 2141: 
 2142: check_test(Config, Test, Opts) ->
 2143:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2144:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2145:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2146:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2147:     case epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, PrivDir}| Opts]) of
 2148: 	{ok,Forms} ->
 2149: 	    Errors = [E || E={error,_} <- Forms],
 2150: 	    call_format_error([E || {error,E} <- Errors]),
 2151: 	    Errors;
 2152: 	{error,Error} ->
 2153: 	    Error
 2154:     end.
 2155: 
 2156: compile_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2157:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). ">>, Test0],
 2158:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2159:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2160:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2161:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2162:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2163:     case compile_file(File, Opts) of
 2164:         {ok, Ws} -> warnings(File, Ws);
 2165:         {errors, Errors}=Else ->
 2166:             call_format_error(Errors),
 2167:             Else;
 2168:         Else -> Else
 2169:     end.
 2170: 
 2171: warnings(File, Ws) ->
 2172:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 2173:         [] ->
 2174: 	    [];
 2175:         L ->
 2176: 	    call_format_error(L),
 2177: 	    {warnings, L}
 2178:     end.
 2179: 
 2180: compile_file(File, Opts) ->
 2181:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 2182:         {ok, _M, Ws} -> {ok, Ws};
 2183:         {error, FEs, []} -> {errors, errs(FEs, File), []};
 2184:         {error, FEs, [{File,Ws}]} -> {error, errs(FEs, File), Ws}
 2185:     end.
 2186: 
 2187: errs([{File,Es}|L], File) ->
 2188:     call_format_error(Es),
 2189:     Es ++ errs(L, File);
 2190: errs([_|L], File) ->
 2191:     errs(L, File);
 2192: errs([], _File) ->
 2193:     [].
 2194: 
 2195: %% Smoke test and coverage of format_error/1.
 2196: call_format_error([{_,M,E}|T]) ->
 2197:     _ = M:format_error(E),
 2198:     call_format_error(T);
 2199: call_format_error([]) ->
 2200:     ok.
 2201: 
 2202: epp_parse_file(File, Opts) ->
 2203:     case epp:parse_file(File, Opts) of
 2204:         {ok, Forms} ->
 2205:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms)};
 2206:         {ok, Forms, Other} ->
 2207:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms), Other}
 2208:     end.
 2209: 
 2210: unopaque_forms(Forms) ->
 2211:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 2212: 
 2213: run_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2214:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). -export([t/0]). ">>, Test0],
 2215:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2216:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2217:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2218:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2219:     Opts = [return, {i,PrivDir},{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2220:     {ok, epp_test, []} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2221:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2222: 
 2223:     case lists:member({feature, maybe_expr, enable}, Opts0) of
 2224:         false ->
 2225:             %% Run in node
 2226:             {module, epp_test} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, epp_test),
 2227:             Reply = epp_test:t(),
 2228:             code:purge(epp_test),
 2229:             Reply;
 2230:         true ->
 2231:             %% Run in peer with maybe_expr enabled
 2232:             {ok, Peer, Node} =
 2233:                 ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-enable-feature","maybe_expr"],
 2234:                            connection => 0}),
 2235:             {module, epp_test} =
 2236:                 rpc:call(Node, code, load_abs, [AbsFile, epp_test]),
 2237:             Reply = rpc:call(Node, epp_test, t, []),
 2238:             peer:stop(Peer),
 2239:             Reply
 2240:     end.
 2241: 
 2242: fail() ->
 2243:     ct:fail(failed).
 2244: 
 2245: message_compare(T, T) ->
 2246:     T =:= T.
